summary:
Mumbai vs Madhya Pradesh Highlights, SMAT 2024 Final: Shedge wins it for MUM as they claim second title

Date: December 14, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Mumbai's star-studded batting lineup successfully chased down a target of 175 runs set by Madhya Pradesh, winning the SMAT 2024 final.

  • Rajat Patidar scored an unbeaten 81 runs for Madhya Pradesh, helping them post a competitive total.
  • Mumbai, opting to field first, restricted MP to 175 runs in 20 overs.
  • Suryansh Shedge played a pivotal role by scoring a quick 36 runs off just 15 balls, leading Mumbai to victory in 18 overs.
  • Suryakumar Yadav contributed 48 runs, maintaining control over the innings.
  • This match marked Mumbai's second title in the tournament‚Äôs history.
‚ÄúDespite batting at No 3 for RCB in the past, Rajat Patidar has been batting at No 5 for Madhya Pradesh.‚Äù

This thrilling final showcased Mumbai‚Äôs dominance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, further solidifying their status in Indian cricket.
newTitle: Mumbai Claims Second Title at SMAT 2024 Final Against Madhya Pradesh

summary:
Morne Morkel reveals one area where Indian bowlers need to get better at

Date: NEW DELHI Source: Times of India

Morne Morkel, India‚Äôs bowling coach, emphasized the need for improvement among Indian bowlers, particularly during the overs 50 to 80 against Australian batter Travis Head.

  • Morkel noted that the Indian bowlers struggled to execute their strategies effectively.
  • He highlighted the impact of the partnership between Travis Head and Steve Smith, which scored 171 runs in 31 overs.
  • Morkel indicated the need to improve execution during crucial phases of the match with a softer ball.
  • He defended the performance of other bowlers like Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep, commending their efforts despite challenges.
  • Morkel backed Ravindra Jadeja, emphasizing his status as a world-class player despite a tough outing.
‚ÄúFirst of all, we can say he's (Head) in pretty good form... but I think for us with the ball... that's one area I think we need to get better at.‚Äù - Morne Morkel

The Indian bowling team is looking to enhance their game strategy to perform better in upcoming sessions, aiming to contain the scoring rate efficiently.
newTitle: Morne Morkel highlights improvement areas for Indian bowlers

title: "Bowled Really Nicely": Steve Smith's Big Praise For Star India Pacer. It's Not Jasprit Bumrah - NDTV Sports

In a commendable performance during the third Test match, Indian pacer Akash Deep caught the attention of Australia‚Äôs Steve Smith, who noted Deep's remarkable bowling skills despite not taking any wickets.

  • Akash Deep received high praise from Steve Smith for his impressive bowling on the second day of the third Test.

summary:
Ravi Shastri Critiques India's Bowling Performance Against Australia

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Ravi Shastri has voiced concerns regarding the inconsistency of India's bowling attack during the ongoing third Test against Australia at the Gabba, highlighting Jasprit Bumrah's individual brilliance amidst overall underperformance.

  • Jasprit Bumrah took 5 wickets for 72 runs but was the only effective bowler.
  • Australia set a strong total of 405/7, with Travis Head and Steve Smith each scoring centuries.
  • Shastri criticized the lack of discipline among other bowlers, stressing the need for a consistent strategy.
  • Bumrah leads the series with 17 wickets, significantly ahead of the next best Indian bowler, Siraj with 10 wickets.
‚ÄúThey were giving away runs on both sides.‚Äù ‚Äì Ravi Shastri

In conclusion, Shastri's insights suggest that maintaining discipline and consistency in the bowling unit is crucial for India to compete effectively in the crucial Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

"Get Out Of My Space": Australia Great Slams Mohammed Siraj-Marnus Labuschagne Bail-Switching Drama - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Get Out Of My Space": Australia Great Slams Mohammed Siraj-Marnus Labuschagne Bail-Switching Drama

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: NDTV

One of the highlights of Day 2 of the third Test between India and Australia was the 'bail-switching' moment between Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj and Australian batter Marnus Labuschagne. Siraj's superstition led him to switch the bails, only for Labuschagne to switch them back before being dismissed shortly after.

  • The incident occurred during a crucial moment in the match.
  • Labuschagne was dismissed for 12 runs and criticized by Matthew Hayden for being distracted.
  • Travis Head, who replaced Labuschagne, scored a century and formed a strong partnership with Steve Smith.
  • Head now has over 1,200 runs against India in international cricket since 2023.
"He saw 55 deliveries, and had no go forward whatsoever. Even that little exchange, if it was me at the crease and a bowler does that. I am not caring less." - Matthew Hayden

Labuschagne's dismissal was a turning point, paving the way for a strong performance from Travis Head and Steve Smith, putting Australia in a dominant position.
newTitle: "Get Out Of My Space": Australia Great Slams Mohammed Siraj-Marnus Labuschagne Bail-Switching Drama

title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 2 Highlights: Travis Head, Steve Smith give Australia full control despite Bumrah fifer - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 2 Highlights

Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Travis Head and Steve Smith's centuries gave Australia full control despite Jasprit Bumrah's five-wicket haul on Day 2 of the ongoing Test at The Gabba.

  • Australia ended Day 2 at 405/7, having successfully crossed the 400-run mark.
  • Travis Head scored 152 runs, marking his ninth Test century, while Steve Smith made 101, ending his century drought.
  • Jasprit Bumrah was the standout bowler for India with a five-wicket haul, bringing his series total to 17 wickets.
  • Official attendance for Day 2 was reported at 34,227, indicating strong interest in the match.
  • Australia gained a significant advantage in the series, now level at 1-1 in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
‚ÄúBumrah has been fighting a lone battle when it comes to Gabba.‚Äù

With rain predicted over the coming days, Australia appears poised to take control of the series unless India can respond strongly with the bat in the upcoming days.

title: Jasprit Bumrah targeted with racially-sensitive comment on air as Isa Guha sparks 'Monkeygate' fear - Hindustan Times
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah targeted with racially-sensitive comment on air as Isa Guha sparks 'Monkeygate' fear

Date: Dec 15, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Former England cricketer Isa Guha has faced backlash after making a racially insensitive comment about Indian cricketer Jasprit Bumrah during a live commentary of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia. The incident recalls the infamous 'Monkeygate' controversy of 2008.

  • Guha referred to Bumrah as a ‚Äúprimate‚Äù during her commentary.
  • The comment sparked outrage on social media, recalling the 2008 incident involving Harbhajan Singh.
  • Bumrah has been a standout performer in the series, achieving his 12th five-wicket haul on the same day.
  • The term used by Guha raised historical sensitivities among fans, particularly linked to past racial slurs in cricket.
  • Brett Lee praised Bumrah's performance prior to Guha's comment.
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs the MVP, isn‚Äôt he? Most valuable primate, Jasprit Bumrah.‚Äù - Isa Guha

The criticism aimed at Guha emphasizes the importance of language in commentary and the sensitivity surrounding racial issues in sports.

title: 'I'd have told Mohammed Siraj to get out...': Hayden fumes at Labuschagne for falling victim to bail-switching tactic - Hindustan Times
summary:
‚ÄòI'd have told Mohammed Siraj to get out...‚Äô: Hayden fumes at Labuschagne for falling victim to bail-switching tactic

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Australian cricketer Matthew Hayden expressed his frustration with Marnus Labuschagne for allowing Mohammed Siraj's bail-switching tactic to affect him during the third Test match against India.

  • Labuschagne was dismissed for 12 runs after a fiery exchange with Siraj, who switched the bails, similar to a technique used in the past.
  • Matthew Hayden criticized Labuschagne's lack of composure and urged him to focus on the game rather than engage with Siraj.
  • The match saw Australia struggling at 38 for two, before recovering to 69 for two with contributions from Steve Smith and Labuschagne.
‚ÄúI probably would have told him to get out of my space before he even got to the bails,‚Äù said Hayden regarding Labuschagne's reaction.

Overall, the incident highlighted the mental challenges players face during high-pressure situations in cricket.

summary:

The Milwaukee Bucks secured their place in the NBA Cup final after a 110-102 victory over the Atlanta Hawks, led by Giannis Antetokounmpo's impressive performance.
